comments.body: is the intent for the `0.1` tag to follow the latest `0.1.x` tag?

Yes. I was thinking the patch version would be bumped when we rebuild the image without changing anything else. We still need to figure out a better story for managing tags across the board though, so I didn't bother to write this down... WDYT?
SGTM, but we should probably formalize this, since we don't have a clear policy on this yet. (e.g `fluentd-gcp:1.28` doesn't point to `1.28.2` right now, but it maybe would in the future?)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@# in the Google Developer Console.

FROM gcr.io/google-containers/debian-base-amd64:0.1

COPY Gemfile /Gemfile

@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@    apt-get install -y gcc && \
    apt-get install -y make && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* /tmp/* /var/tmp/* && \
    curl -s https://dl.google.com/cloudagents/install-logging-agent.sh | bash

comments.body: I see that the .conf file to use needs to be provided in FLUENTD_ARGS. May be document that somewhere?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +48,52 @@# line argument.
COPY google-fluentd.conf /etc/google-fluentd/google-fluentd.conf
COPY google-fluentd-journal.conf /etc/google-fluentd/google-fluentd-journal.conf

# Start Fluentd to pick up our config that watches Docker container logs.

comments.body: optional: may be add "mkdir -p /var/log/journal/" here .. in case someone starts the container with google-fluentd-journal.conf, but without mounting the journal.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@COPY google-fluentd.conf /etc/google-fluentd/google-fluentd.conf
COPY google-fluentd-journal.conf /etc/google-fluentd/google-fluentd-journal.conf

# Start Fluentd to pick up our config that watches Docker container logs.
CMD /usr/sbin/google-fluentd "$FLUENTD_ARGS"
